title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
Hi there have 820-00165 here, no sign of liquid damage. was showing green light and did quarter fan spin on SMC bypass. 
At the moment it has no green light. Also pin 3 on U7100 is showing 0.3v but PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL on R7110 is shwoing 16.6v
Pin 2 is 16v

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: PPbus is 0.6v however was 8.6 when green light was on

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: Check if there is a short on F7140, also seems that U7100 is dead...

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: No short to ground on there, and it's got continuity between the two ends. Just replaced U7100 and it's the same symptoms. Sometimes has green light, sometimes it doesn't

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
CHGR_ACIN level stable, low/high?
You must get aprox 4V there; if not, remove C7111 first.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: After U7100 it's now at 4V

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: so there must've been definitely something with u7100 as it's now showing green light consistently

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: but no fan spin of course

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
Do you get correct PPBUS_G3H now?
Post some other signals required for start up...

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
PPbus is correct. 8.56
Just to confirm, the S5 states should all be there but none of the other states should be right? like S4, S0 etc.?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
In OFF state, you must have S5 and SUS voltages present, when charger connected.
But this board should start automatically once charger is connected.
Post signals and voltages which are present in your case.
Check for any pulse (at least) at 5V coil, when connect charger.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: Oh all S5 rails available and correct. Would that indicate SMC?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: Ok checking now

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
5V coil gave a super quick pulse to around 0.3v 

PPBUS_G3H 8.56
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS 8.56
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS 8.65
PP3V42_G3H 3.4
PPVRTC_G3H 3
PP5V_S5 5v
PP3V3_S5 3.3
PP3V3_SUS 3.3
PP1V05_SUS 1v

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
Check if all coils pulse.
Give time and look if cycle.
If not, trigger SMC_ONOFF_L repeatedly and check the coils.
See also if pins 7 & 3 of U1950 pulse.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
Looks like All coils pulse slightly. Just rechecked L7520 and it pulsed all the way to 4V

7 and 2 pulse too

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: sorry, pin 7 and 3 i mean pulse too

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
Do you note cycling every 5s?
Or just get 1, or 2 pulses when charger connected?
Check if all voltages try to appear (page 58); don't forget VCORE.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
No cycling at all. just initial pulse when power is connected. 

58 on my schematic is Power Fets. Do you mean 68 power aliases?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
NO, just page58.
Check for short beyond these MOSFETs and also look if all the voltages try to appear (pulse at least).

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
OK I'm half way through, it's a ton of work. basically all of the lines are pulsing. both in and out volatges. they're not present but they are pulsing when connected. But two things which are strange.


1. PP1v05_S0 only has 200 ohms somestimes less to ground, in fact in continuity mode my multimeter beeps.

1. and this one is completely bizarre to me. U8050 and the line SMC_PWR_EN is 0V when power is going to the macbook. as soon as I disconnect it goes to 3V. WTF? it takes at least 30 seconds for the 3 volts to disappear even though there's no power going to the board

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: Another strange issue. PP3v3_S3_FET_R is down on every other mosfet and only pulsing except for U8020. it has permanent 3.3v there

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: Checked all of them, apart from the strange issues mentioned above, I have found no other problems. I do wonder what's different about U8020 though

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
"PP3v3_S3_FET_R is down on every other mosfet and only pulsing except for U8020"
PP3V3_S3_FET_R is not related with U8020.
Do you get stable 3V3_SUS?

"U8050 and the line SMC_PWR_EN is 0V when power is going to the macbook. as soon as I disconnect it goes to 3V"
Do you mean SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN?
Check SMC_PBUS_VSENSE level.
Remove Q5050 and see if SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN changes its reaction.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
Sorry yes I meant 3v3_sus is down on everyone except u8020
and yes SMC_PWR_EN whoops

SMC_PBUS_VSENSE is down

Hmm I can't find Q5050 on the board view

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: you mean Q5500 right?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: No changes to SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN when Q5500 is removed

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
Yeah, Q5500.
SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN is controlled by SMC.
When power is disconnected, SMC cannot pull it down and some remanent voltage on the board will keep it high.

Did you try BIOS?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: Can I take BIOS off another 00165 donor? Or will it need programming?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
You can try with a chip from donor, IF you know is good for sure.
If not, reflash the chip; don't forget to make backup first.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: no changes with known working BIOS. SMC next?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
Mmmhh, I don't think, if the board tries to start at least.
But this cannot assure 100% good SMC.
Did you check if VCORE pulses too?
Also check for voltage pulse at all L/C blocks close to PCH, near PCH corner...

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
Actually PPVCC_S0_CPU doesn't pulse at all. it's completely dead
What do you mean by L/C blocks close to PCH?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: you mean the caps and coils top row right?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: actually wait, PPVCC_S0_CPU is a dead short. seeing if I can hopefully find a dead cap

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: What is resistance? Dead short would be 0 ohms on these not a low value...

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
So you can detect pulses on all coils, less the CPU ones?
Post exact resistance to ground, in ohm scale this time.
Compare with values from known good working board; with same type of CPU (i.e. i5, or i7)

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message:
Yep, definitely short, 1.5 ohms to ground.

correct. all coils except those on that line it seems

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: Then dead CPU, sorry :(

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: Shit hahahaha NOOOOOOOOO

title: 820-00165 green/orange light sometimes. no fan spin
message: thank you for your help. i confirmed it to be the CPU. removed every component on that line with only CPU left and it's short. so then I decided to put 30v through the line since it's dead anyway and CPU heats up. So i guess this thread is solved haha
